籤字的基本解释

籤
qiān
见“签”③籤⑥。

籤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiān］
［《廣韻》七廉切，平鹽，清。］
“签2”的繁体字。
(1)指竹片或纸片上写有文字符号的一种标识。
(2)指书签。
(3)签注处理意见的一种公文。
(4)指对公事签署处理意见。
(5)书卷、画轴封套所用的牙质帙签。多悬于卷轴旁。也称“牙籤”。
(6)泛指书籍卷帙。
(7)书籍的封面题签。
(8)旧时官府拘捕、惩罚犯人的凭证。
(9)尖锐细长的杆状物。
(10)古卜具。民间或寺庙中供求神佛卜问吉凶所用的签牌。多竹制，常写有文字符号或诗句。
(11)古代夜间计时报更用的竹签。
(12)贯穿；刺；插。

籤字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　籤； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页905第16
【廣韻】七廉切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】千廉切，?音簽。【說文】驗也。一曰銳也，貫也。【玉篇】竹籤，用以卜者。　又典籤，官名。【北史·蕭泰傳】泰子寶未弱冠，名重一時。隋文帝輔政，引爲丞相府典籤。　又【正韻】幖也。

籤字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
籤字的起名意思

暂无。

sign

sign
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiān］
["Guangyun" Qilian cut, flat salt, clear. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "signed 2".
(1) Refers to a kind of logo with characters written on bamboo or paper.
(2) Refers to bookmarks.
(3) An official document that endorses the handling opinions.
(4) Refers to the signing of opinions on official matters.
(5) Dentin sticks used in the envelopes of scrolls and scrolls. Hung over the scroll. Also called "toothpicks".
(6) Refers to the volume of books in general.
(7) The cover caption of the book.
(8) The evidence used by the government to arrest and punish prisoners in the old days.
(9) Sharp and slender shafts.
(10) Ancient divination tools. A lottery used in folk or temples to ask the gods and Buddhas to ask good and bad luck. It is made of bamboo, often written with text symbols or verses.
(11) The bamboo sticks used in the ancient night time report.
(12) Penetration; thorn; insertion.
sign

[Not set on] [Bamboo Character Department] 　 Sign; Kangxi Strokes: 23; Page Number: Page 905 16
[Guang Yun] Qi Lian cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Qian Lian cut,? Sound signature. [Said Wen] Experience also. One said Rui Ye, Guan Ye. [Jade articles] Bamboo sticks, used for divination.　Another signature, official name. [Northern History·Xiao Tai Biography] Tai Zi Bao was not weak, and he was famous for a while. Emperor Wen of the Sui Dynasty served as the prime minister's official signature.　[Zheng Yun] again.
